Params: {3: 'You walk from the bridge into a tight new room. The round light strip on the ceiling turns on by itself.'}
{3: 'Holograms show deep blue star maps and data. You check them one by one, and nothing looks important.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: "We were wrong. This ship isn't an Eden III joint craft anymore. It belongs to... Kurono.", 4: '1'}
{3: "After some checking, Discord exhales slowly. She's relieved that she doesn't have to face that person and the past yet."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Shiva', 3: 'Why would an Ascendant frequent this place?', 4: '18'}
{3: "The ship's lights switch to harsh red. Status screens flicker with chaotic data."}
{3: 'Thick alloy plates slide out of the walls. Sections seal off, leaving only the main corridors.'}
{3: 'Yata, scouting ahead, turns around, and in a blink a special alloy wall cuts her off.'}
{3: 'You tap the partition that blocks all signals and call Yata and Shiva on the comms. No one answers.'}
{3: 'An hour passes, then two. Time slips by unnoticed.'}
{3: "Nothing in the room changes. There's no natural light. From the hunger in your stomach, it's likely you have been stuck here for a day."}
{3: "You do not dare rest. You search the small conference room again and again, but you still can't bring up the ship's control system."}
{3: 'Some projections pop up by mistake. Others show that after a major mission and return, this ship was turned into a ground intelligence site.'}
{3: "You're on the ship's middle deck. The meeting room terminal holds hundreds of hours of routine video logs. Most other data has been moved or erased."}
{3: "You come up empty and hope Discord's custom scissors on the other side can physically damage the partition."}
{3: 'If brute force works, mechanical arms would be more effective than blades. Yata on the other side has likely already tried that first.'}
{3: "Maybe Yata can't reach Shiva outside either."}
{3: 'Ten hits, a hundred, a thousand, ten thousand... At this rate, the weapon will break first.'}
{3: 'The blue-haired Construct walks back, looking sorry.'}
{2: "I'm okay.", 3: '82', 4: "I'm glad to see you back.", 5: '82'}
{3: 'She gives a simple reply, thinks for a moment, and shows a small, relieved look. This new frame really does feel different.'}
{2: 'We wait for Shiva to lift the lock from outside.', 3: '88'}
{3: 'Shiva may come. Or she may not.'}
{3: 'Discord repeats the new mission in her mind, puts away the scissors, and sits hugging her knees. Projected Chernoff faces circle her, revealing the emptiness within her.'}
{3: "The 3D faces are frightening, but they're only statistics and test data."}
{3: 'Just then, the pained faces start to beg for mercy in all directions and throw a wide, twisted curtain of corrupted light.'}
{3: "When they mock each other's ugly faces, they don't see that each one is also a mask they themselves wear."}
{2: 'Memory interference?', 3: '105', 4: 'Is the Punishing Virus concentration rising?', 5: '105'}
{3: "The blue-haired Construct's M.I.N.D. starts to drift from the interference. You sense something's wrong and establish a connection at once."}
{3: 'Chaotic thoughts spread before your eyes like a huge, tangled web.'}
{3: 'Discord curls into herself tightly, huddled among those grotesque, absurd faces that appeared moments ago.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'Even if I finally remember those memories and strong feelings... were they ever really mine?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Discord', 3: "How can I be sure it isn't all just an illusion?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'No one can give a clear answer.', 3: '126', 4: "We only experience so much in our life. It's hard to judge what's real or not.", 5: '126'}
{2: 'Discord', 3: "I still remember those happy moments, but they feel like someone else's...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You maintain a strong connection with the Construct. Her tangled past and feelings are slowly being sorted and synced.'}
{2: "Don't rush. Trust who you are now.", 3: '133', 4: "Good or bad, they're your memories. But you don't have to let them define you.", 5: '135'}
{2: 'Discord', 3: "In the past, I escaped reality by just following orders. I don't want... to do that anymore.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'After many broken days, she finally breaks free of the Emotion Trimming and gets room to think freely again.'}
{2: "We do missions also to protect what's beyond the missions.", 3: '142'}
{3: 'She relaxes her hands, tips her head up, and starts to picture the ideals you believe in and the path you walk.'}
{2: 'Our companions.', 3: '147', 4: 'Our lives.', 5: '147', 6: 'It can be simple too, like music.', 7: '147'}
{2: 'These are the goals we strive for, the motivation that drives us toward the future.', 3: '148'}
{3: 'Your words echo in her M.I.N.D., and a stitched-back memory rises.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Shorthalt', 3: 'I have things I care about too.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Shorthalt', 3: 'When you find the things you care about again, tell me about them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Discord', 3: 'He once asked me to tell him what I care about...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'The clinical data used to repair your M.I.N.D. came from a Construct named Wanshi.', 3: '167'}
{2: "He's also one of the people Shorthalt cared about most.", 3: '170'}
{3: "Discord's pupils tremble violently. A question left hanging years ago finally gets an answer."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lilako', 3: 'What happens to what you value, to what you care about...?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Definitely not to be forgotten, to be crushed.'}
{3: 'It starts as a thin thread, then reaches out to others, and in the end it weaves everyone together.'}
{3: "It's no longer a choking web. It's a bond that holds tight and gives support."}
{3: "Led by this sense of order, the Construct's M.I.N.D. settles. There's no need to send out your Mind Beacon anymore."}
{3: 'You let out a breath and sit beside her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'I used to think everyone I cared about left me, betrayed me.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'There might be no funeral and no time to say goodbye.'}
{3: 'Which comes first, disaster or tomorrow? One can never be ready.'}
{2: 'Treat those as goodbyes that were always going to happen.', 3: '201'}
{3: 'She thinks over your answer carefully, then nods.'}
{2: "What's your hope?", 3: '205', 4: 'What drives you toward the future?', 5: '205'}
{3: 'You offer your hand to the crouching Construct.'}
{2: "Don't forget, we're walking this path with you.", 3: '211'}
{3: 'Just then, the ship seems to wake up. Sealed partitions slide open, lights turn green, and the deck connectors retract inward, neatly revealing the lower level.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: '...Is the lockdown lifted? Did Shiva succeed?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Contrary to their hopes, a gray-haired Ascendant appears from the dark.'}
{2: "Wasn't Cerberus supposed to be watching the target?!", 3: '227', 4: 'The original? Or a clone?', 5: '229', 6: 'Trouble for sure.', 7: '231'}
{3: 'In a flash, Discord weaves magnetic lines around you two. Her giant scissors rise, hanging in front of her, edges gleaming, ready to strike.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'Long time no see, 【kuroname】. You never lack protectors at your side.', 4: '1'}
{2: "I certainly didn't want to see you.", 3: '240', 4: "She's my companion.", 5: '240'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'Since you moved so fast, you must know this place is useless to you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "And the assassination list in this data... I don't need it anymore.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The Ascendant shows a projection of the physical chip on purpose, making it clear this may be the most valuable target of your mission.'}
{2: 'Then why did you come back?', 3: '244', 4: 'Your last revenge went too far.', 5: '248'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'Would you believe I only wanted to see you?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'If you live for revenge, it will not end well.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'What do you even know about me?!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Annoyed, the Ascendant manipulates the virus around him. A burning pain rips through her M.I.N.D. and into your mind through the connection.'}
{3: "Corrupted data tries to break in. With the pain, the deep M.I.N.D. connection shows you more of Discord's mental images and memories."}
{3: 'Step by step, her notes start to make a melody, and the melody will become a song.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'You were once a tool shaped by Kurono too. We should have plenty to discuss.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "For a start, you should see the world's truth with your own eyes.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'Thanks for the tip, but I see clearly enough.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "If you do, you'd understand which side you should be on...", 4: '1'}
{2: "She'll never choose your side!", 3: '272', 4: 'She has her own path.', 5: '272'}
{3: 'The Ascendant sweeps the scythe, a strong gust shattering the magnetic lines and pinning you to the cabin wall.'}
{1: '1', 3: "Discord's face twists ferociously. She bares fangs slick with vital fluid and fury, half hidden by her opening mask and the steam from her cooling unit."}
{3: "She attacks in an instant. Her silhouette flickers with deadly lines through the air, but the Ascendant's scythe cuts down every single one."}
{3: 'When the blade pulls back, it carries only a single strand of silver-gray hair.'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "If you'll hear me out, I can hand you the data. You'll finish the mission easily and everyone walks away happy.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Her nerves rage. They push her toward deep, trained reflex.'}
{3: 'Cold sweat runs down. She almost bows her head, then remembers her neck, once held by many restraints, is bare now.'}
{3: 'The Construct no longer hesitates. The Ascendant throws the chip aside with a sigh, grips the scythe again, and shifts stance to gather strength.'}
{2: '??', 3: 'Jump down. Your target is right there.'}
{3: 'She breaks the stubborn phantoms and meets the new attack head-on.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'There are things more important than finishing the mission!', 4: '1'}
{3: "They move too fast to see. After many quick clashes, the Ascendant's scythe and Discord's scissors lock together and screech with a sound you can almost see."}
{3: "The scissors' edges push inward against resistance, trying to snap the tip of the scythe."}
{3: 'Ephialtes shows a look of surprised approval.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'All right. Want to see which is sharper?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'Still, two against one is not very polite.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With the deadlock broken, Yata drops tactical camouflage and throws a sudden punch.'}
{1: '1', 3: "Surprisingly, Ephialtes doesn't dodge, as if he knows it's coming. The punch still drives him back a few steps."}
{3: 'The locked force releases. Discord drives the scissors into the floor to keep from falling with the recoil.'}
{3: "Yata sees that camouflage doesn't work on him. She doesn't overextend, flips back a few times, and keeps a safe distance."}
{3: "Discord's M.I.N.D. deteriorates fast. She's being pushed toward a loss of control. She can't move her body. Her scissors slip from her hand with a clang."}
{3: "You concentrate all your effort on maintaining the connection, sweat beading on your brow. You know the Ascendant hasn't even begun to fight seriously."}
{1: '1', 3: "Pain crosses her face. She can't answer."}
{3: 'Yata steps in harder and faster. Afterimages seem to tear the air.'}
{3: 'Yet the Ascendant switches to defense and puts away his weapon.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "Enough. I'm not in the mood to drag this out. More of your friends are on the way, right?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Seeing through your delaying tactics, Ephialtes offers a dignified, shallow bow.'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: "Until my new plan is ready, I don't plan to fight all of Babylonia.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ephialtes', 3: 'The deal is done. Until next time.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'As the Ascendant retreats, a very dense force gathers, causing the air around him to visibly warp and discolor.'}
{3: 'Too close. No time to pull the scissors back to block!'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Yata fires a low-power flash with her palm down, uses the force to jump, and puts herself in front of Discord. She blocks the beam at the last possible moment.'}
{3: 'Even so, Fulgor takes a heavy hit and keeps sliding back, carving two black scorch lines on the ground.'}
{3: 'Behind her, Discord hits the edge railing. The metal snaps, and she falls all the way to the bottom level.'}
{3: 'The short-haired Construct shakes off a brief limb glitch and checks the area fast.'}
{3: "The Ascendant is gone. Propped up, you're still dizzy from the broken connection and not yet awake, but your life is not in danger."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yata', 3: "Fulgor's block is far from enough for the high Punishing energy an Ascendant can gather. I need to raise the strength...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She looks at the deep cracks in her lower frame and winces. Moving freely will be hard. Even walking may be a problem.'}
{3: 'Still, not getting blown to pieces is a win.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yata', 3: 'Well, at least that creep is really gone.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yata', 3: 'Ascendants really do come in all kinds.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The short-haired Construct clicks her tongue and calls down.'}
